self.philbrown.cssparser

Interface CSSHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultCSSHandler

    public interface CSSHandler
    Interface for receiving parse events from the CSS Parser.
    Since:
    2:39:59 PM Dec 18, 2013
    Author:
    Phil Brown

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • handleError

        void handleError(String error,
               Throwable t)
        Handle a parse error. This is called before the parser exits.
        Parameters:
        error - the error message
        t - the error. This may be null.

      • handleImport

        InputStream handleImport(TokenSequence importSequence)
        Handle the @import At-Rule
        Parameters:
        importString - the name of the file to input. This can be interpreted any way.
        Returns:
        an InputStream associated with the given name, or null.

      • handleNewCharset

        void handleNewCharset(String charset)
        Alerts the listener that a @charset At-Rule has been parsed and handled by the Scanner.
        Parameters:
        charset - the charset String. FIXME: this needs further tests.

      • handleNamespace

        void handleNamespace(String namespace)
        Handle the @namespace At-Rule.
        Parameters:
        namespace - the namespace

      • supports

        boolean supports(TokenSequence logic)
        Gets whether or not the logic is true for the given @support query
        Parameters:
        logic - the supports logic to query
        Returns:
        true if the support block should be included (at the end of the CSS Input Stream). Otherwise false.

      • handleKeyframes

        void handleKeyframes(String identifier,
                   List<KeyFrame> keyframes)
        Handle @Keyframes At-Rule
        Parameters:
        identifier - the name of the keyframes animation
        keyframes - a list of the keyframes

      • handleFontFace

        void handleFontFace(FontFace font)
        Handle the @Font-Face At-Rule
        Parameters:
        font - the FontFace that has been parsed.

      • queryMedia

        boolean queryMedia(TokenSequence[] types)
        Query to see if the given media is supported. If so, the logic within will be appended to the end of the css input stream
        Parameters:
        types - a list of media types used for the media query
        Returns:
        true if any of the the given media is supported

      • handlePage

        void handlePage(TokenSequence pseudoClass,
              List<Declaration> properties)
        Handle the @page At-Rule
        Parameters:
        pseudoClass - the pseudo-class
        properties - the list of properties

      • queryDocument

        boolean queryDocument(TokenSequence[] functions)

      • handleRuleSet

        void handleRuleSet(RuleSet ruleSet)
        Called once the parser has completed.
        Parameters:
        ruleSet - contains all the parsed rules
